placeInfo/address: Kirawanagama Road Lower Blackwood, Nikapotha, Beragala 71622 Sri Lanka
text:
We loved our stay at Dream Cliff. From the moment we arrived we were greeted with a warm welcome and stunning views of the sun setting over the mountains. We enjoyed cocktails on the terrace looking out at the view before a delicious dinner in the atmospheric outdoor terrace, with the backdrop of lovely piano music being played by a very talented member of staff. 
Our beehive, Zircon, was a treat to stay in - a beautiful bathroom, very comfortable bed and a spotless terrace where we enjoyed sitting outside and listening to the sounds of the many birds. Make sure you have your binoculars to hand to take a better look at the varied birdlife including Sri Lankan Grey Hornbills and huge Kites.
We enjoyed a refreshing dip in the pool before we left, we were sad to leave Dream Cliff! Thank you for having us.
title: A highlight of our Sri Lankan holiday

ownerResponse/text: We have indept looked into your feedback. Some of the points we agree and try and improve our services but there are many that we cannot agree on. However thank you for giving this feedback as we will try and improve our services shortly.
placeInfo/address: Kirawanagama Road Lower Blackwood, Nikapotha, Beragala 71622 Sri Lanka
text:
Nous avons séjourné 3 nuits dans cette hotel.
La vue
La vue est superbe y compris depuis les bungalows

Les chambres
L’idée des bungalows isolés en forme de ruche est bonne sur le principe. Par contre peu ou pas d’isolation entre la partie chambre et la partie salle de bain/toilette….bonjour l’intimité.
La décoration des chambres manque cruellement de goût.. mais c’est effectivement une histoire de goût.

Le service
Le personnel est très gentil est accueillant mais pas au niveau attendu pour le prix payé.
De plus on avait demandé à l’hotel de nous réserver des billets de train pour un voyage 2eme classe reserved seats. Il nous ont facturé une somme indécente pour le service rendu et nous n’avons pas obtenu les billets demandés. Ce qui nous a laissé la désagréable impression de nous être fait flouer.
Nourriture du restaurant et du petit déjeuner de faible qualité et sans saveur. La viande est souvent trop cuite.
Dans l’ensemble, le prix demandé pour cet hotel est beaucoup trop élevé pour le niveau de service délivré.
Nous avons eu l’occasion de séjourner dans des hotels de bien meilleur qualité pour beaucoup moins cher au Sri Lanka.
Je ne recommande pas cet hotel. Rapport qualité / prix décevant.
title: Prestations pas au niveau du prix demandé

ownerResponse/text: No more words can better your review. Hope to see you again soon in Sri Lanka. Thank you.

placeInfo/address: 61 Marine Dr, Colombo 00600 Sri Lanka
text: We stayed two nights, separated by 10 days. Both stays were too short, the first one was coming from airport and leaving next morning on a bus, second coming in the evening by train and leaving at 4AM for the airport. Next time we hope to stay longer and really savour the experience. I am not sure how much we paid (tour group), but it was worth every penny and much more. Treated like family from the moment you get down from the bus. Excellent spacious rooms. Quick elevators. Enough power outlets. Bathroom was superlative. View of course!! Indian ocean across the road, rail track and beach. The 1st floor restaurant is all glass, looking out on the ocean. Excellent Buffet the first night and next morning. The second night, it was past 9pm and they gave us a Set Menu which was also excellent.  And when they found out we had to leave at 4AM they OFFERED to give us packed breakfasts, choice of veg or non-veg. Made fresh at 4AM, sandwiches, cup of fruit and a bottle of water. Everyone I said that to, said "Wow! THAT is hospitality!" Their motto is "Work Hard and Be Nice to People" and they really live up to that and more. We felt that we were leaving old friends, when we checked out. Really hope to be back. In some 60 years of wandering the planet, I cannot think of a handful of hotels that were this memorable. What would I want changed? Nitpicking here, but Vattalappam as I remember from the 1960s was less spongy, more coconut milk and jaggery flavor. Maybe time has distorted my memory, but that was one of my Must-Haves, and they had that as option the last night Set Menu. With the Buffet you don't have space on plate or tummy for much of this.
title: "Work Hard and Be Nice To People" is their motto and how they live up to it!!

Es ist ein wunderbares Hotel. Alle sind so nett. Die Zimmer sind groß und sauber. Das Essen ist hervorragend. Die Kellner (insbesondere Malith) sind unheimlich hilfsbereit. 
Ich würde dieses Hotel auf jeden Fall jedem empfehlen, der einen entspannten Urlaub machen möchte.
title: Eine tolle Erfahrung

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you so much for your beautifully written review!

We're overjoyed to hear that you enjoyed your stay at Morning Dew and that the views, rooftop pool, and warm service made your visit memorable. It’s wonderful to know you appreciated the local flavors at our restaurant and took full advantage of the tranquil yet central location.

Our team works hard to create that perfect balance of comfort, nature, and convenience—and your kind words truly mean the world to us. We hope to welcome you back again for more magical sunrises and relaxing moments above Ella.

Warmest regards,
Hotel management.
placeInfo/address: Wamullahena, Ella 90090 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Steep hill up to the hotel, so you need to use shuttle bus to get up with luggage
text:
We stayed two nights at the Morning Dew and absolutely loved our time here. The hotel is perfectly located at the top of Ella, offering stunning 360-degree views over the lush landscape. Watching the sunrise and sunset from this spot is truly magical.

The rooftop pool is a highlight – it feels like you’re floating in the sky, surrounded by nature. The service was warm and attentive, and both the breakfast and dinner were excellent – flavorful local dishes served with a smile.

It’s only a short walk downhill to the center of Ella with its cozy cafés and shops, but be prepared for a steep climb back. Luckily, the hotel offers a convenient shuttle service during the day, which we happily used.

Morning Dew is a serene and scenic retreat, perfect for relaxing while still being close to everything Ella has to offer. Highly recommended!
title: Sky-High Views and Warm Hospitality ‘Above’ Ella

text:
Great hotel, we stayed in the king quiet and the views were phenomenal! The staff are amazing even let us let off some fireworks out the front! The rooms are beautiful, beds are very comfy! There is a very steep hill upto the hotel but they arrange a car to take you up and down for free.

placeInfo/address: Wamullahena, Ella 90090 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Make sure you take every opportunity for sunrise or Sunset on top. Little Adams peak at Sunrise is a must do too.
text: Absolutely stunning hotel in the mountains of Ella. It must have the best view. It is a strong steep walk up the hill, a Tuk Tuk which needs a little help or a quick ride up on the hotel minibus, but it is amazing. The hotel has an infinity pool which looks across to the Buddhist Temple and a fantastic sunset. The restaurant is just down some steps and is great for lunch and evening meals. The view in  all directions is perfect with the Waterfall also across from the restaurant. It is certainly Boutique and has lovely rooms with very good size balconies. Good air con, great beds, great showers, great service. The breakfast is on the lower level and you can sit on the veranda. Good buffet breakfast with Sri Lanka n dishes available. We stayed 3 nights and managed to spend a night in town then walk up. I could easily stay longer. Loved it.
title: Beautiful Boutique Hotel with Beautiful Views and Wonderful Staff

ownerResponse/text: Es freut mich sehr zu hören, dass ihr eine unvergessliche Zeit im Yala Park hattet! Das Glamping-Erlebnis klingt wirklich einzigartig, besonders mit der tollen Ausstattung und den persönlichen Touches im Zelt. Es scheint, dass der Safari-Ausflug mit Dilhara ein echtes Highlight war – die Informationen über die Natur und Tiere machen die Erfahrung noch wertvoller. Und der Tipp für die Spaziergänge und Nachtwanderungen ist wirklich hilfreich! Ich kann mir vorstellen, dass ihr noch lange an dieses besondere Abenteuer zurückdenken werdet.
placeInfo/address: Situlpawwa Road Kochchipathana, Yala National Park 91400 Sri Lanka
text:
Das Glamping im Yala Park war einfach nur toll! 
Wir waren hier 2 Nächte in einem Zelt untergebracht. Das Zelt hat eine tolle Ausstattung und ist sehr geflegt und sauber- sogar eine kleine Dusche und eine Toilette gibt es im eigenen Zelt. Das Essen im Camp war super lecker- auf jegliche Wünsche wurde Rücksicht genommen (Vegetarisch usw.)
Unser persönliches Highlight war unsere Ganztages Safari im Yala Nationalpark- es war ein traumhaftes und absolut einzigartiges Erlebnis, dass so schnell keiner von uns vergessen wird. Unser Safari Guide war Dilhara- er erklärte uns so viel Wissenswertes über die Natur und die Tiere im Yala Park und konnte uns auch jede Frage charmant beantworten. 
Noch ein Tipp: Wenn ihr die Möglichkeit habt an den Nachmittagsspaziergängen oder am täglichen Night Walk teilzunehmen, macht dies aufjedenfall! 

Wer ein einmaliges Erlebnis im Yala Park haben möchte, sollte diesen Aufenthalt im Glamping auf keinen Fall missen!
title: Einzigartige Zeit im Yala Park

You’re absolutely right – safaris are always unpredictable, and while there are days with an incredible variety of animal sightings, other days can be quieter, as you experienced. text: After reading reviews we decided to visit Yala national park with Mahoora but it was a complete waste of money. We had already visited an elephant sanctuary and saw 2 elephants driving to Yala so of course we really wanted to see a leopard. Obviously wild life is completely unpredictable but we had booked the exclusive safari package which other than your own private jeep means absolutely nothing. We paid 405 USD for a nights stay in a tent which had more animals than the park in it (including a big enough lizard), mediocre dinner where you couldn’t see what you were eating, disgusting breakfast and of course the “private” safari. Our “guide” didn’t even introduce himself so I don’t know his name which straight away gave me a bad vibe. He didn’t give much information about anything - we saw deer, rabbits and millions of birds but it’s nothing we can’t see at home for free. We spent 3 hours driving around bumpy roads for absolutely nothing. We got a tip about a leopard and there was about 50 other jeeps and we could barely see the leopard he was so far up in the tree but still can say we saw one atleast. We were so happy to be leaving after one night it was more than enough. As I said wildlife is unpredictable but I really wouldn’t recommend this and if you are tight on budget and considering skipping it do! We went to the elephant freedom project for 1/10 of the price and had a lovely day with so much interaction with elephants!
title: Bird watching NOT safari. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY!

placeInfo/address: De Abrew Road, Kalutara 12000 Sri Lanka
text: One of my most enduring memories of the hotel will be the staff. Absolutely first class. You are greeted with smiles, warmth and treated like you are the only guests in the hotel.   The hotel  itself is older in style, right by the ocean, in large, well kept grounds.  Public areas are spacious and airy, with attractive Sri Lankan decor. The rooms ( we booked a deluxe for 4 weeks ) were attractive, ours was very comfortable. Nice bed linen and towels. Plenty of hot water,  good pressure in the shower and quality toiletries. Great facilities, large well maintained pool  with swim up bar and extensive sun bathing areas.  There are also indoor lounges and bar areas which offer evening entertainment, plus a spa.  The food was varied, always something we could eat -  good local fresh fruits;  huge range of salads;   hot western style food of all kinds;  amazing desert display plus delicious Sri Lankan and sometimes Indian specialty dishes. The location allows you to explore more of Sri Lanka.  We also wanted  a relaxing getaway from the colder European winter and it certainly delivered on that. There are a few local bars and shops close by.  The sea was quite wild when we were there and the sound of the waves against the shore was incredible.  We met many people who had stayed several times: which says it all really!
title: Well recommended.

text: На отдыхе были в декабре 2024 года. Климат в это время года шикарный! Очень уютный отель, приветливый и всегда улыбчивый персонал. Жили в номере делюкс с шикарным видом на океан. Уборка ежедневная и давольно неплохая.Брали только завтраки. Меню многообразное, голодными точно не останетесь !!! фрукты предлагались все, что можно, что очень порадовало. За территорией много кафешек с приемлимыми ценами.Особенно понравился ресторанчик Sea Shell: расположен на втором этаже,с вентлятором, русскоговорящем официантом и вкусной едой. Пляжа ,как такового, нет, но когда успокаивается шторм, подход к океану хороший и плавать комфортно. Познакомились с местным гидом Амаль, очень отзывчивый,неплохо говорит на русском языке. Ездили с ним на сафари в парк Яла, все прошло отлично! Возил на своём тук-туке по местным достопримечательностям. Вот его вотсап +94-71-309-87-78. От отдыха остались в полном восторге!!!
title: Незабываемый отдых в декабре 2024 года  на Шри-Ланке отель Танжерин.

roomTip: Avoid prime time for dinner and breakfast it gets very busy and queuing is non existent most of the time although lunch time was much better
text: We have just returned after spending a week at this lovely hotel where the staff worked very hard to make your stay an enjoyable experience. My birthday co-insided with our stay and the staff made a real effort in the room which really made it a special day and the evening meal was accompanied with a birthday cake and a burst of Happy Birthday a lovely touch indeed. Our room overlooked the pool and sea and despite the overcast conditions which were unexpected during our stay we managed to make the most of the facilities using the free half hour massage which was excellent though I did not get a chance to use the gym which was very well equipped indeed. Meals were generally quite good although the dining room was very busy at breakfast and dinner where there were little manners on show by many of the guests and the high expectation of the dress code I had read about prior to traveling was non-existent so do not worry about bringing too many pairs of long trousers guys as you will not need to wear them as I had expected! The room was very nice and spacious, you may need a few extra hangers but everything else is supplied and the room staff including the evening check by the housekeeping team was a nice touch were excellent and the room was kept to a very high standard ..well done! my only issue was the mattress which was very hard as I did not have a full nights sleep throughout the stay there though I did not complain as everything else was great. Entertainment at night was good but such a shame it was not better supported where the artists were excellent with possibly the exception of the magician. I must say we were pleasantly surprised to find we were allowed two glasses of wine each with our lunch and dinner a real bonus when we were not expecting this treat! So overall a good visit, lovely hotel, great staff who go out of their way to make the stay special...Thank you
title: lovely hotel just a shame about the weather

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,

Thank you so much for your wonderful review! We're thrilled to hear that you and your friend had an amazing time and got to experience the incredible sight of leopards on safari. It’s great to know that Dilhara, along with our guides and drivers, helped make your tour memorable.

We’re also delighted that you enjoyed the beauty of our camp, the quality of the food, and the comfort of the tents. Our team works hard to ensure every guest has a special experience, and it means a lot to hear your appreciation.

Thank you for recommending us, and we hope to welcome you back for another wild adventure in the future!

Best regards,
placeInfo/address: Situlpawwa Road Kochchipathana, Yala National Park 91400 Sri Lanka
text: I went with a friend (two women) and we had the most amazing time! Not only we got to see leopards in the safari, which came with professional guide and drivers (ask for Dilhara for the tour), but the overall staff attention was invaluable. The place is beautiful, the food is good and the tents are clean and comfortable. There is hot water inside. I truly recommend it!
title: A wild and amazing experience

ownerResponse/text:
Hi Cciantar

Thank you for sharing your experience and for appreciating the safari, the atmosphere, and the service provided by our team. We're pleased to hear that you enjoyed the wildlife encounters and the overall ambience of the camp.

However, we are sorry to learn about the loss of your valuables. While we understand how distressing this must be, we must respectfully clarify our position on this matter.

During your stay, our Guest Relations Officer provided a comprehensive welcome briefing. This included a clear explanation that the tents are not equipped with safety lockers, as they cannot be locked like hotel rooms. The briefing was translated to your group by one of your companions who understood English, ensuring that everyone was informed.

We also made it clear that safety lockers are available in the welcome area, which is clearly visible and accessible to all guests. Unfortunately, you chose not to use this facility. Additionally, at check-out on the 24th, when asked if all belongings were accounted for, you confirmed that everything was in order.

It was only on the 26th of August, through your tour agent, that we were informed of the missing items. Moreover, you confirmed that your valuables were last seen just before your departure from the camp, and from that moment, all bags were under your care and confirmed that everything was in order before your departure.

As a responsible company, we took immediate action by thoroughly checking the premises and questioning our staff. Our head of operations has been in touch with your tour agent, Jayamali, and provided all the necessary details regarding this situation.

While we cannot take responsibility for the loss of your valuables, we hope that this experience will not overshadow the positive memories of your stay.

Thank you again for your feedback.

Best regards,

Anuruddha Bandara
placeInfo/address: Situlpawwa Road Kochchipathana, Yala National Park 91400 Sri Lanka
roomTip: You cannot trust your belongings in these tents.
text: After an amazing experience at the camp which included, Vima a nice Safari guide who knew all about the wildlife we encountered and having a big nice camp with hot shower, BBQ dinner including a nice atmosphere with bonfire we had a big surprise. Arriving at our next destinations after leaving the camp in a rush I opened my luggage and found that valuable things and money were missing. This was to our surprise being in the wild with no-one around.  Just you have to make sure to have a lockable luggage when staying at this place
title: unexpected surprise

ownerResponse/text:

Thank you for your detailed review! We’re delighted to hear that Mr. Raj, Sagara, and Manjula made your stay comfortable and memorable, and we appreciate your recognition of their efforts. It’s great to know that you enjoyed the early safari and the arranged transport out of the camp.

We’re glad you had a rewarding safari experience with Samantha and Dilhara, despite the unpredictable wildlife sightings.

placeInfo/address: Situlpawwa Road Kochchipathana, Yala National Park 91400 Sri Lanka
text:
Wonderful stay made comfortable and assuring by led by Mr Raj and the crew including Sagara & Manjula. Mr Raj was of great service and help by picking me at 4am in the morning from the gates in total darkness, he also assisted in checking me in early which allowed me to catch an early safari. He also arranged transport out of the camp by a local driver which was helpful. Much appreciated. Overall all the staff try their best to make guests comfortable. 

Safari was well guided and driven by driver Samantha and naturalist Dilhara, whom I spent most of my time with on private safari. Managed to spot leopards on some safaris but on others we couldn't spot any at all.

Areas to improve: at Big Game Camp, it was communicated that amenties include shower gel and shampoo but only shampoo was provided. As a guy, thats ok as we are more flexible, but for ladies it will matter more and if communicated, it should be provided. Daily meals were randomly switched between locations within the campsite as well, which made guests like myself confused too.
title: Great stay with Raj & team

text: Amazing! The whole experience from the moment we arrived to the moment we left. We paid for the whole deal: Afternoon Safari with Vishwa (awesome guide), afternoon tea, 5 course dinner under the stars around the campfire, night walk included, sleeping in awesome family glamping tent sealed with a delicious breakfast by the pond with the peacock walking by! What a memorable treat. A family time we will remember forever - worth every penny. It pretty much cost $880 AUD for our family of four ($220 per person) - great value for what we received. ownerResponse/text:
Hi Craig,

As you have deleted your previous review and our response, we are responding to this review again.

Thank you for choosing our property after extensive research (4 years of study according to your last review) and finding us capable of delivering a great experience. We deeply regret that your stay did not meet your expectations.

After thoroughly investigating the incident and speaking with our staff, we are puzzled by your dissatisfaction, particularly regarding our team's conduct. Even our sales colleague, Nathasha, who has been in close communication with you throughout, is at a loss as to why you felt our staff were rude.

While we apologize for your negative experience, we would like to address some of the points raised in your current review. We promptly attended to the concerns you raised, including the double payment issue due to miscommunication. Hence, we politely reject your statement that we have been dishonest. In fact, we checked you out without charging for the extras, trusting that you will make that payment after making any adjustments you need.

We appreciate your feedback and are committed to improving our services. We hope to have the opportunity to provide you with a better experience in the future.

With regards,

ownerResponse/text:
Hi Kal,

Thank you so much for your heartwarming review of your recent stay with us at Mahoora!

We are absolutely delighted to hear that you had such a memorable experience. Our team always strives to go above and beyond to ensure our guests feel welcomed and cared for, and it's incredibly rewarding to know we made your stay enjoyable.

We're thrilled that you loved the food and dining settings. There's something magical about enjoying a delicious meal under the stars, and we're glad you experienced that magic. We're also happy to hear that you found the tents to be luxurious and comfortable, there's nothing quite like a refreshing shower and a cosy bed after a day of adventure.

Your kind words about our safari experience have made our day! Our driver and ecologist were just as excited as you were to spot that elusive leopard. It's moments like these that make the safaris truly special.

Thank you once again for choosing Mahoora as your base to explore Yala National Park. We hope to welcome you back soon for another unforgettable adventure.

Warmest regards,
placeInfo/address: Situlpawwa Road Kochchipathana, Yala National Park 91400 Sri Lanka
text:
We had a 2 night stay here and loved it!! The staff are so friendly and helpful and they made our stay so enjoyable. They went above and beyond to help us the whole time we were there and we'll always remember this team for how hospitable they were. 
The food was excellent & plentiful and the dining settings are lovely. It was so enjoyable eating great food under the stars.
The tents themselves were fantastic. It's a real luxury to be able to have a decent shower and bed when your camping!
In terms of the safaris, we were very happy. We had a great driver and ecologist and had immediate access to the park so we didn't have to wait. As a bonus, our brilliant driver spotted a leopard for us (the first one seen for quite a while), so we were very happy!!
Overall, this was a great experience and we were so happy to have chosen Mahoora!
title: A great base to see Yala National Park!

placeInfo/address: Wamullahena, Ella 90090 Sri Lanka
text:
Morning Dew has been beyond fantastic. When I first checked in I was immediately taken to the beautiful rooftop terrace for complimentary drinks while my luggage was taken to my room. The view of waterfalls, mountain ranges, and lush vegetation from the roof cannot be accurately expressed in words.

Beyond the hotel itself the staff now feel like friends after my 48 hour stay. Malith and Ruwan stood out as exemplary employees. When I woke up for breakfast they were there and remembered me by name. When I came back from my hike they made sure that I was comfortable despite the influx of new visitors. 

Do yourself a favor and stay here....not just for the views but for the personal experience the staff brings

placeInfo/address: Sigiriya Road, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text:
1.位置非常好，步行就可以去狮子岩
2.酒店完全是现代化设施，房间、庭院、大厅及泳池，每一项都禁得住细节推敲
3.必须要说这里的是这里的服务：从经历到员工，能感受到他们是带着愉快的心情在这里工作，每个人脸上都有笑容。
4.一些难忘的细节：每天桌面上的鲜花朵、时常打扫的走廊与泳池、每天在庭院的不同位置摆放桌椅甚至小型沙发，都会让人感受到工作人员的用心❤️
帮我整理房间的小哥Gihan，第一天帮我叠了天鹅🦢太可爱了，第二天我说不用天鹅了很费时间，于是给我叠了一颗❤️，很童真、很温暖。

非常推荐入住这里，除了狮子岩，更可以租赁酒店自行车，去公园附近转转，是观鸟的好去处～

ps.自行车可以事先调整下座位：p
title: 令人身心愉悦的时光

placeInfo/address: Sigiriya Road, Sigiriya 21120 Sri Lanka
text:
We stopped by for one night on our Sri Lanka roadtrip. After a long tuk tuk ride we were utterly charmed by the lovely decor, well kept facilities and warm and friendly staff. 

Regarding location, it was perfect for us because it was a short walk to Sigiriya Lion Rock, which is why we came to Sigiriya. 

After the hike, we had a super tasty breakfast at the hotel. We opted for the Sri Lankan breakfast and the chef actually came out to chat with my husband about his dietary restrictions and ensured he had something delicious for brekkie.

After breakfast we went into the pool, which was perfectly cool and in a shaded area. The pool area was clean and they provided towels on request. 

The room was beautiful and decorated in a classic SE Asian style. Very clean and tidy, and clearly well-kept.

The Ekho team were all super professional  and friendly; from the guard to reception to waitstaff and other team members, it was top notch customer service. This is supported by the fact that we had issues with our tuktuk and everyone without question came to help us out and get us safely on the road. I would highly recommend Ekho if what you’ve read ticks the boxes for what you are looking for.
title: Beautiful setting, top notch service and delicious food

placeInfo/address: Kaluwamodara, Beruwala 12070 Sri Lanka
text:
Today i have finished a delightful restful holiday  here at the edan .A beautiful hotel on the edge of the beach with caring attentive staff
 We arrived 14 days ago tired after a long flight throughout the night however the moment we walked through the door we were greeted with warm smiles and a can do attitude 
 Our room on the ground floor was immaculate  clean with a large bathroom and flowers on the bed a great touch. We were able to step out of our room through our balcony to a great pool ideal for cooling down on a hot sunny afternoon or watching children have fun swimming safely.There was even a swim up bar what more could you want
The sun loungers were siruated on grass with views of the sea and the palm squirrels running around kept us entertained while we rested
 The staff at this hotel from the delightful   guest relations  ladies with their candles and warm smiles  to the pool man  to all the waiters bar attendees cleaners and security  people  are a credit to the hotel stopping to chat  engage and inform us of this beautiful  country .No question we asked however stupid was  not answered  fully showing your culture to our hearts
It inspired us to go on several excursions and enjoy this beautiful place 
The food was  delightful especially the ala carte restaurant  and the breakfast buffet  allowing us to enjoy a typical siri Lankan  meal or breakfast  thanks to all the chiefs that fed us 
We must also take the time to thank the spa staff for the  beautiful  massage  me and my wife enjoyed 
We will certainly  be back
title: Fabulous holiday

placeInfo/address: Kaluwamodara, Beruwala 12070 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Go and enjoy your time there
text:
We recently spend 2 weeks in Eden and it was really great experience.The hotel is very clean and the service was brilliant.Despite it being end of season in sir Lanka everyone did their very best to keep the bar high and not take foot of the pedal . Best place to stay if you are looking to try real SirLankan kitchen with abundance .Western food was also great . If you have really sweet tooth as my husband has variety of local -continental deserts and cakes are always available.Breakfast and dinner served as a buffet with separate pancake and waffles station.If you like to experience local and traditional dishes each morning and evening you could try it to . All stuff appreciated that we both try new things each day . Lunch was a game changer with a la cart menu that want repeat even once through our stay . Big shoutout to F&B manager who chatted with us each time around .Pest SPA for me in long time .Absolutely brilliant.Great pool ,very clean around and open for snacks and drinks throughout the day . 
 Big shoutout to lovely ladies from guest relations area especially Yoshundura ( hopefully pronounced correctly) I had a bit emergency on my first night in hotel .She offered me support of hotel doctors ,arranged a room service and waited with me till the swelling from my eye gone down ( us Brits ) love sun !!!
Sri Lanka delivered big time for us with Eden
title: Great Holiday!!

We spent five nights at The Bartizan in February and really enjoyed our stay there. The location is perfect for exploring the vast fort and the lanes within it.
From the moment we arrived, Andrew the manager welcomed us and showed us to our room. He was helpful and gracious throughout our visit, always checking if we needed anything.
Our room was a quirky one at the top of a spiral staircase with a fabulous outside space, and even more fabulous views. The bed was very comfortable and the shower great with complimentary toiletries, not to mention a view of the lighthouse.
Breakfast was perfect and plentiful, a fruit plate, toast and bread rolls and a cooked choice as well. They even catered specially for my fussy choices!

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,   

We appreciate you taking the time to leave yet another review.  However, we are disappointed to see the same concerns being posted across multiple platforms despite our previous response. While we respect your right to share feedback, repeatedly highlighting the same issues feels unfair, especially considering the efforts we made to address your concerns.

The Bartizan is over 200-year-old colonial property, carefully restored to balance modern comforts with its historic charm. We strive to provide clear and transparent information by detailing our rooms and amenities on third-party booking platforms within the parameters allowed. The ground floor courtyard room you booked is our most economical option, and all its features were accurately displayed before booking. While we understand that personal preferences vary, it is unfair to judge our hotel so harshly based on a misunderstanding of the type of property you booked.  

Regarding the used water bottles under the sink cabinet, we sincerely apologize. This was an oversight by our housekeeping team, as the bottles were inside a closed space. Had you mentioned this during your stay, we would have immediately addressed it, as guest satisfaction and cleanliness are top priorities for us.  

As for the wall patches you photographed, we acknowledge that they appear unfinished. Unfortunately, this was due to paint bubbling on the centuries-old walls, an ongoing challenge we continuously work to maintain. In this instance, the repair had not yet been fully completed before your arrival, and we regret that this affected your impression of the room.

Due to these concerns, we did provide you with a 50% refund as a goodwill gesture which you failed to mention in your review. Had you not used the room for the entire night and left your belongings inside until check out time next day, we would have even offered a full refund. Our team remained polite and accommodating throughout, ensuring that you were treated fairly.

We appreciate that you revised your rating in the first platform you posted, but we still find it disappointing that you have chosen to reiterate the same complaints multiple times despite the fair treatment you received. We encourage all future guests to carefully review our room descriptions and photos to ensure our boutique colonial property aligns with their expectations.  

Thank you again for your time, and we wish you all the best in your future travels.  

Best regards,  
The Bartizan Team
placeInfo/address: 77 Pedlar Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text: This was probably not the best choice of hotel for us. We expected a "modern, stylish hotel" as advertised on their website. Instead, our small courtyard room was as per the attached photos - walls had been polyfillered but not sanded or over-painted; the under sink cupboard was full of dirty old used water bottles. Perhaps the cracked concrete walls and floor are part of the charm but it was lost on us. We re-located to another hotel.
title: Disappointing

placeInfo/address: 77 Pedlar Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
My room was the superior balcony room with a partial sea view.

Firstly, all the hotels within the city walls have a certain configuration so you may not have the usual benefits of other hotels. Nonetheless, our stay at the Bartizan was a relaxing one. Although we had a partial view of the sea, the view was still nice to have and hearing the waves at night was very smoothing for me personally. 

The room was spacious enough for 2 people. It is very dimly lit and no TV is within the room. No lifts as well but I believe the other hotels within walls have the same layout. Coffee and tea were complimentary alongside the items inside the mini-bar, which was helpful in terms of not having to always buy water. Our room had a AC unit and an overhead fan.

There was an option to have breakfast on our balcony, which we took and proved to be very convenient. The staff very quickly cleaned up once we gave them a call. The staff were always very friendly and courteous, even offering us an umbrella to shade us from the fierce heat. They helped us check in smoothly and were accommodating to our needs. Andrew (who I believe was the hotel manager) always greeted us whenever we entered or left the hotel alongside the other staff members.

Located really close to the sea, all the main sites and restaurants are easily reachable from the hotel. A section of the Galle walls is right outside the hotel, so you can start your walk of them straight away.

I had a lovely stay in Galle and would recommend the hotel if you are staying for a short period, or even using it as a base to cover other sites close by.
title: A lovely setting for a 2-night stay.

ownerResponse/text: Dear madam Sharom, thank you so very much for the wonderful review of the hotel. The Bartizan is a beautiful heritage building that is maintained with much love. The balconies which are unique to the fort because of their size, and views of the ocean are indeed breathtaking. Thank you for mentioning the showers they are designed to completely wash away any heat of the day and return you to the comfort and coolness of the room and bed. The North tower is a smaller tower room category with its own private balcony that gives views of the ocean and the fort and at nights stars and moonlight. Chef sends his heartfelt thanks regards the compliments about the breakfast and the rest of the staff too. Please return to stay with us at the hotel Bartizan in the Dutch fort the next you visit Galle. Thank you and sincerely, Andrew Milhuisen (GM)

ownerResponse/text: Dear Madam Noeleen, Thank you so very much for the thrilling review of the hotel, hotel standard, value for money, room, mini bar, towels and staff. Your kindness is appreciated so much and along with the staff and myself we are sending you best wishes and warm tropical embraces all the way from the island of Sri Lanka, the Dutch fort and the Hotel Bartizan, always. Thank you, and  sincerely, Andrew Milhuisen (GM)
placeInfo/address: 77 Pedlar Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
The Bartizan hotel Galle was a joy to stay in . We spent 3 nights there , we had a court yard room ,it was small but had everything  you could want it in. Very comfortable bed & pillows , spotless & comfortable , European 5 star standard the room even a hair dryer ! hand towels for taking off make up , nice touches like a full mini fridge with refreshments & treats . 
I feel we paid a fair price for the level of luxury of this hotel , many many others of this standard are a lot more expensive!!
The breakfast was very good ,staff go over & above at all times . 
Andrew the GM is a very professional & kind person. Arranging tuk tuks & tours. 
If you’re planning a trip to Galle fort ,this is your hotel.
title: Excellent!

ownerResponse/text: Dear Mr. Morris, Thank you very much for the beautiful review of the hotel, staff, room amenities, room features, quality of service and myself. It is deeply appreciated. You and Mrs. Morris are always and forever welcome at the Bartizan and in the Galle fort. It was a pleasure to be of service and your appreciation is rewarding more than is imaginable. Thank you and sincerely, Andrew Milhuisen (GM)
placeInfo/address: 77 Pedlar Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Home from home. You are in good hands here. Everything you want just ask.
text:
We loved our stay at The Bartizan Hotel, Galle Fort. Andrew, the manager is brilliant.
We stayed three nights and because we were staying in a small room we got upgraded on our last night.
Unlike alot of hotels in Sri Lanka, everything in the room works! Sockets, good shower, fridge stocked with free drinks etc and air-con that does not wake you up!!
Great breakfast, lovely staff and restaurant recommendations as well as advice on shops, tuc tuc etc.
We were overcharged in a shop in Galle and Andrew and staff went back to the shop with my wife to renegotiate the price!! That is the level of service at the Bartizan.
We would love to stay again and without reservations I would highly recommend. 😎
title: Our Favourite Hotel In Sri Lanka

ownerResponse/text: Dear madam Preeti, what a wonderful review and thank you so very much indeed. I am thrilled and the staff are thrilled. its always so amazing to be mentioned so kindly. Thank you. The beds are special because they were imported from very far away to the most sensitive specifications following the contours of the sleepers body. The pillows were chosen the same way. To provide the most comfort imaginable. Thank you once again for the kind compliments and we look forward to you coming to stay with us at the Hotel Bartizan when you next return to Dutch fort in Galle. Andrew Milhuisen (GM)
placeInfo/address: 77 Pedlar Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
Bartizan is a hidden gem of a boutique hotel , with very simple understated Dutch colonial feel ! Taking very good care of it is Andrew the general manager , who is extremely helpful and genial along with his very capable n friendly staff ! Special mention has to be made to the most comfortable bed provided , ideal after a hard day of sightseeing and walking ! 
Well done n keep up the good work !
title: Heritage gem

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Mr. Peter and Family, 
Thank you so very much for the promised review of the hotel and service. We thoroughly enjoyed your stay with us. We hope that your journey into the interior of the island and then Northwards has been as exhilarating and full of adventure as we envisioned. Please always remember you have friends and family in the Galle Dutch fort and the Hotel Bartizan who will always welcome you and see about your every need. Looking forward to seeing you once more and wishing you a safe journey, a Merry Christmas and a fabulous New Year. Thank you and sincerely, Andrew Milhuisen (GM) The Hotel Bartizan, The Galle Dutch fort.
placeInfo/address: 77 Pedlar Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
I stayed with my family at The Bartizan Galle Fort at the begining of our trip around Sri Lanka.  We had a family room with a balcony and views of the fort walls and the ocean which were maginifcant. 

Our stay included a delicious and generous breakfast which we took on the roof terrace while watching the moorning walkers and ocean view.  A plate of fresh fruits, fruit juice, toast, croissant, and a choice  of Sri Lankan breakfast or eggs.  

During our stay all the staff were extremely attentive and very helfful from Andrew, the manager, to the securuty gaurd who was by his post from morning to night with a huge smile on his face.

An unforgettable experience and If you can afford the price tag I highly recommend a stay at The Bartizan.
title: A superb experience at The Bratizan.

placeInfo/address: 331/1 Lewis Place Negombo Beach, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text: So good! I travelled solo to Negombo and I chose hotel J Sri Lanka. The hotel staff is very friendly, security wise amazing and the food is 10/10🥹 gahhh I would totally recommend this to anyone out there! Definitely coming back again!
title: solo trip to Negombo

placeInfo/address: 331/1 Lewis Place Negombo Beach, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text: Basic hotel.  Good lift.  Breakfast very good.  Lovely beach view.  Seaview room a must.  It probably is not the best part of Negombo so a tuk tuk tour is recommended to really get a proper impression of the town.  Didn’t use the pool but looked very to lie on the pool lounges.
title: Basic but good hotel for the price.

title: Great stay....

placeInfo/address: 331/1 Lewis Place Negombo Beach, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka

placeInfo/address: 331/1 Lewis Place Negombo Beach, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text:
While I was staying at Hotel J, something unfortunate happened my phone was stolen. I was overwhelmed and didn’t know where to begin. But these angels called Theekshana and Ruban stepped in and truly changed everything for me. No hotel deserves a staff like them. They’re beyond incredible and super heros.

They helped me file a police complaint, stayed with me through the entire process, and never once made me feel like a burden. They gave me their time, energy, and kindness without expecting anything in return. Because of their incredible support, I actually got my phone back.

Thank you, Ruban and Theekshana. And thank you, Hotel J, for having such wonderful souls on your team. I’ll never forget this.
title: Theekshana and Ruban

placeInfo/address: 331/1 Lewis Place Negombo Beach, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text: A good hotel to stop in for proximity to the airport. Staff were attentive and rooms were clean. Pool was well maintained as were beach loungers. Would stay again for a night. Good location and very close to the beach if you ever want a stroll. Location is a highlight
title: Well located for airport

placeInfo/address: 331/1 Lewis Place Negombo Beach, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text:
We visited as a family with kids room 311.
Front desk staff theekshana was amazing.
Sorted all the booking issues and also served us breakfast and we needed paracetamol. He was quick to serve us dealt all inquiries. Theekshana is an amazing staff member who made the stay comfortable for us. 
Great budget hotel and sea access
title: Great stay

placeInfo/address: 331/1 Lewis Place Negombo Beach, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Don’t expect a super fast service, they’re understaffed on long weekends and busy days. But if there’s any delay, they will make it up.
text: It’s one of the best hotels I’ve visited in that range!! They say it’s a budget hotel, but the food, the rooms, the view, the pool, the rooftop bar, the staff and the management will make you wonder if it’s really a budget hotel, because everything is up to the standards of a luxury star hotel..!! Don’t expect them to answer the phone if you visit on a really busy day like a long weekend, but they will make it up to you. Food is à la carte, but they don’t serve up to your room. Get a sea view room, because the view at sunset is heavenly. Or you can simply walk into the lawn or the beach as it’s right there, or the rooftop, and enjoy the view from there while sipping a cold one.
title: A luxury, star-level quality hotel for a budget price

placeInfo/address: 331/1 Lewis Place Negombo Beach, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text: the rooms were good, food was good. we had a satisfying experience. Beach view was brilliant, Staff was commendable. We were upgraded which was very good. Car park was next to the property. Location was brilliant with Restaurants within walking distance.
title: Allround Satisfying Stay

text: I wish to acknowledge the wonderful service offered by management and staff at the Hotel J Negombo.  During a recent stay 8/4/25 – 13/4/25 my wife was hospitalised due to ill health. I will definitely stay at Hotel J again and recommend all friends and family to stay at Hotel J.  To the staff and Mr. Vimukthi Peiris thankyou!

placeInfo/address: 331/1 Lewis Place Negombo Beach, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Avoid this hotel
text: Awful rooms. Arrived around 1030pm after 15 hours travelling. No air con, no fridge, no water, no kettle. Asked where we might buy something to eat or drink- nowehere. If I could have jumped back on the plane back home, I would have. Bed with a filthy sheet. Only saving grace was breakfast a la carte on first morning. Hard pass.
title: Hard pass

placeInfo/address: 331/1 Lewis Place Negombo Beach, Negombo 11500 Sri Lanka
text:
The staff were consistently lovely, friendly, attentive, and always ready to help with anything we needed. Their service really made a difference and gave the hotel a welcoming, relaxed feel.

The breakfast was excellent with a good variety, and the food in general was also great - We ended up eating at the hotel more than planned because it was so convenient and good quality.

Service throughout our stay was fantastic, from check-in to checkout. Everything ran smoothly and nothing was too much trouble. It’s a well-run hotel that gets the basics right and adds a personal touch. We’d definitely stay again.
title: We had a great stay at Hotel J!

title: Un moment de calme sur la plage

Siamo felicissimi di sapere che il suo soggiorno all’Araliya Red sia stato così piacevole e rilassante. Ci fa molto piacere sapere che ha apprezzato l’eleganza della struttura, la comodità delle camere, la varietà del buffet e il comfort offerto dalla spa e dalla piscina riscaldata.

Araliya Red – Nuwara Eliya
placeInfo/address: No. 9/36, Unique View Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
Araliya Red è stata una piacevolissima sorpresa: un hotel moderno e curato, perfetto per una sosta tra le colline fresche di Nuwara Eliya. La struttura è imponente ma accogliente, con spazi comuni eleganti e camere ampie, pulitissime e dotate di ogni comfort.

Il clima fresco è una meraviglia dopo il caldo del resto dello Sri Lanka, e rende il soggiorno ancora più rilassante. Bellissima anche la vista sulle montagne e sul verde circostante, soprattutto al mattino. Colazione e cena a buffet abbondanti e di qualità, con tanta varietà per tutti i gusti. Anche la spa e la piscina riscaldata sono un plus davvero apprezzato.

Il personale è sempre cordiale, professionale e disponibile ad aiutare per qualsiasi esigenza. Ottima anche la posizione, vicina al centro ma in zona tranquilla.

Consigliatissimo per chi vuole coccolarsi un po’, godendo di un clima piacevole e un’atmosfera elegante nel cuore dell’entroterra.
title: Eleganza e comfort nel cuore fresco di Nuwara Eliya ⛰️

placeInfo/address: No. 9/36, Unique View Road, Nuwara Eliya 22200 Sri Lanka
text:
The grandest hotel on our trip around Sri Lanka. 

First must say that this is not our kind of hotel, too grand and ostentatious, we prefer boutique hotels. 
With a gold-plated elephant in the Reception and gold-plated adornments around the lobby we knew that this would not be our first choice. But having said that, it still is a great hotel and obviously caters for meetings and conferences (luggage x-ray scanner is reception says it's not just a vacation hotel)

Room was equally decorated and fitted to a high standard.

We did use the very small pool but felt too busy with 6 people in it.

Restaurant was huge and ornate with a very large selection of very good, tasty food, with a guitarist playing during the evening.

Staff were incredible as everywhere being super friendly and helpful
title: The grandest hotel on our trip around Sri Lanka.

ownerResponse/text:
Sehr geehrter Gast,
wir bedanken uns herzlich für dies wundervolle Bewertung.

Es erfüllt uns mit großer Freude zu lesen, dass Sie einen so wunderbaren Aufenthalt bei uns im Occidental Eden Beruwala hatten.

Unser engagiertes Team, insbesondere unser geschätzter Barkeeper Shameera und unsere Mitarbeiterin Eashani, haben Ihren Aufenthalt zu etwas ganz Besonderem gemacht. Die buddhistische Zeremonie, an der Sie teilnehmen durften, spiegelt die authentischen kulturellen Erlebnisse wider, die wir unseren Gästen gerne ermöglichen.

Die positive Resonanz zu unserem vielfältigen All-Inclusive-Angebot und der reichhaltigen Auswahl an vegetarischen Speisen bestätigt unseren hohen gastronomischen Standard. Die einzigartige Lage unseres Resorts, wo der Bentota-Fluss auf den Indischen Ozean trifft, schafft perfekte Bedingungen für entspannte Momente am Wasser.

Wir freuen uns sehr darauf, Sie bei Ihrem nächsten Besuch in Sri Lanka wieder bei uns begrüßen zu dürfen.
Mit herzlichen Grüßen

The Management
placeInfo/address: Kaluwamodara, Beruwala 12070 Sri Lanka
text:
Wir durften 8 Tage im Hotel Eden verbringen. Wir wurden von der 1 Minute an bis zur Abreise vom sehr freundlichen und aufmerksamen Personal umsorgt. Besonders erwähnen möchten wir den Barkeeper Shameera und Eashani. Mit Ihr durften wir an einer Buddhistischen-Zermonie im Hotel teilnehmen. War eine sehr tolle Erfahrung, danke dir Eashani und dem ganzen Hotel. Wir hatten All-Inklusiv gebucht und wir können das Buffet nur empfehlen. Auch für Vegetarier ist genügend Auswahl vorhanden. In den Indischen Ozean fliesst auf der Höhe des Hotels der Fluss Bentota was das Wasser nicht so salzig macht. Planschen möglich.
Unser Fazit vom Aufenthalt in Sri Lanka; wir waren zum 1. Mal hier aber bestimmt nicht zum Letzten Mal. Das Hotel und das Land sind zu 100% empfehlenswert.
title: Wunderschöner Urlaubsort

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,
Many thanks for your kind feedback following your recent stay at our hotel.

Your glowing feedback fills us with immense joy.

placeInfo/address: Kaluwamodara, Beruwala 12070 Sri Lanka
text:
The Eden was our 7th & final hotel in our tour of Sri Lanka before we departed home. 

We arrived to a warm welcome by the staff. When we were shown to our room, we found it to be slightly dated & it felt like a bit of an anticlimax from what we’d been used to during our trip to Sri Lanka. 

We realised quickly that the bath/shower set up leaked all over the bathroom floor. I raised this with reception & asked to move rooms. We then received an upgrade & the upgraded room was brilliant, it was like a completely different hotel. The staff couldn’t have done any more for us with regards to resolving this issue. 

The upgraded room was spacious & immaculately presented. The food during our evening meals & breakfast was fantastic. 

It was great to wind down & relax around the pool area after 10 days of travelling. 

The beach area was accessible, but the beach is situated on the mouth of a river. Probably not the most hygienic to be swimming in, the sea is notoriously choppy a lot of the time with strong currents from the river so it was sensible not to go any further than a paddle. 

Overall, we really enjoyed our time at Eden. Thank you for a lovely stay.
title: Lovely hotel, helpful staff.

roomTip: Meditationszentrum auf der kleinen vorgelagerten Insel
text:
Großes und dennoch familiäres Hotel direkt am Strand. Als Single-Mom war ich super happy, dass mein Sohn im Kids Club immer wieder für ein paar Stunden sehr gut betreut war. Ein besonderer Dank geht an Navee, der sich rührend um die Kleinen gekümmert und viele kreative Ideen mit den Kindern verwirklicht hat. 

Das Essen war sehr gut und ich habe es tatsächlich geschafft, den Urlaubspfunden ein paar mal beim Wasser-Aerobic die Stirn zu bieten. Es gibt ein breites Animationsprogramm, aber kein „Muss“ zum Mitmachen, was ich sehr entspannt fand. 

Fast direkt gegenüber befindet sich eine kleine Insel mit einem wundervollen Meditationszentrum, wenn man mal nach einem ganz stillen Ort sucht.
title: Strandhotel, das keine Wünsche offen lässt

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Don Jako,
We are deeply moved by your detailed account of your stay with us.

Your glowing review fills us with immense pride.

We are delighted that you appreciated our distinctive architectural design and prime beachfront setting, complemented by our meticulously maintained grounds. Your recognition of our exceptional service standards warms our hearts, from the attentive front office team to our dedicated housekeeping staff who maintain pristine accommodations.

It brings us great satisfaction to know that our culinary offerings exceeded your expectations, with our diverse menu selections and outstanding dining atmosphere at both the Garden of Eden and Sippi venues. The passionate commitment of our food and beverage team, led by our talented chefs, truly shines through your words.

Your appreciation of our personalized care and attention to detail, especially regarding your partner's specific needs, exemplifies our dedication to creating memorable experiences for each guest. The warmth and professionalism of our entire team, from management to service staff, reflects our genuine commitment to hospitality excellence.

We eagerly await the pleasure of welcoming you back to your home away from home.
Best regards,

The Management
placeInfo/address: Kaluwamodara, Beruwala 12070 Sri Lanka
text:
Every visit to The Eden Beruwala reminds me of the structure of the Captain's Bridge of the mighty Titanic or any large commercial vessel upon entering Eden Resort. This five-star establishment is truly remarkable, offering breathtaking views of the sea based on my observations. The resort is blessed with an eco-friendly environment and boasts a stunning beachfront surrounded by lush greenery, alongside the awe-inspiring sight of the beautiful sea and a hillside monastery that we enjoyed during our stay at Eden. 
The hotel lobby is impressive, spacious, and impeccably clean, presented in a highly attractive manner. The young team at the front office works diligently, and we must commend them for their professionalism, attention to detail, and willingness to assist at any time. We received a wonderfully warm welcome from the hotel staff, who ensured our comfort throughout our stay from the very first day at this lovely establishment. The treatment we received from the hotel team was exceptional, and the rooms assigned to us exceeded our expectations; they were beautifully presented, spotless, and equipped with all the necessary amenities. My partner required extra care during this trip, and the hotel team consistently ensured she felt happy and comfortable, helping even before we asked for it. In my personal experience, the resort team is truly a **GEM**. 
Thank you, Rohan, Yohan, and your exceptional team—an incredible group of individuals, professional in their roles and attentive to detail, always humble and kind. The remarkable aspect of this team is their ability to remember guest preferences, making it impressive to witness how they care for their guests at Eden; it is truly an extraordinary experience. 
The fantastic food and beverage team at the hotel acts and thinks in alignment with their operational leaders, demonstrating excellent training; they are incredibly friendly, professional in their service, polite, and always willing to help. The housekeeping team maintained our rooms in pristine condition and ensured the hotel lobby area was well-kept and spotless. The main restaurant, Garden of Eden/Sippi, a new dining venue, offers an outstanding selection of high-quality meals. We enjoyed Sri Lankan Lamp Rice at Sippi on our first night, which was delightful with generous portions; the food spread at the main restaurant during our repeated stay was consistently delicious. 
The dining area boasts a great atmosphere, with a positive vibe evident during meal times. The food is exceptional and served in a hygienic manner to all guests. I must emphasise that excellent vegetarian options were available for guests. The restaurant service was extraordinary, with staff members exhibiting exceptional attention to detail, all of whom were friendly and polite at all times. Once again, thank you to GM Rohan, his fantastic team Yohan, the wonderful front office staff, Suresh, and his charming food and beverage team, Chef Deepal, Viraj, and his terrific team of chefs, who treated us with kindness and politeness. 
The hotel staff were highly professional, caring, and attentive to detail at all times. The standout feature of this entire hotel team is their commitment to exceeding guest expectations, always ensuring you have a superbly relaxed and enjoyable experience.
title: A Truly Unforgettable Experience at Eden Resort – Feels Like Coming Home again

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest,  

Thank you for your detailed review and for choosing The Bartizan for your stay in Galle Fort. We truly appreciate your kind words about our location, breakfast, and, most importantly, our team. It’s wonderful to hear that you enjoyed the sea view from your suite and the sunsets from our roof terrace.  

We understand that some of the design elements of our heritage property, such as room layouts and furniture placement, may not suit all preferences. While we strive to cater to the needs of most of our guests, certain aspects reflect the unique character of The Bartizan, blending modern comforts with its historic charm. That said, your suggestions regarding room facilities, such as adding tables, hooks, and deeper shelves, are noted and will be reviewed for future updates.  

As for the paintwork and signs of aging, we are constantly working to maintain the property through regular touch-ups. However, being a heritage building within Galle Fort, some signs of age are inevitable and add to its character. Even so, we remain committed to ensuring our guests feel comfortable and welcome.  

We appreciate your feedback about obtaining a liquor license and other amenities. These suggestions are valuable as we continue to improve our services and facilities.  

Thank you once again for your thoughtful comments and for recognizing the hard work of our team. We look forward to welcoming you back to The Bartizan, and we hope to offer you an even better experience next time.  

Best regards,  
The Bartizan Team
placeInfo/address: 77 Pedlar Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
The Bartizan is situated right by the Rampart. Everything is easily accessible from the hotel.
Our room (a suite) was spacious and comfortable, and had a great view of the sea. Much could be done to improve the facilities in the room. For example, a table or two, a surface for the fridge (one has to bend down to the floor to use it), more hooks to hang towels and clothes in the bathroom, a deeper shelf in the bathroom on which one might place a toiletry bag, shaver and so on. There were enough plug points! No TV, which is a good thing! It would be good if the hotel obtained a liquor licence and stocked a bar. There is a great little roof terrace from where on can see the sunset.
The whole place could do with a lick of paint, and the damp patches could be treated. Generally, the place is in need of some loving care, but it is still charming. Minor touches and improvements will make a big difference. 
Breakfast in the courtyard was great. Fruit of all kinds to start with followed by a choice of what one preferred; continental, Sri Lankan. Plenty of restaurants nearby for lunch and dinner: the hotel does not provide any meals after breakfast.
The staff were all tremendous; they were friendly and most helpful. All the best to Andrew and the team. I am sure the recent arrival of Andrew will make a big difference, and the place will improve.
title: A great little hotel

ownerResponse/text:
Dear Guest, 

Thank you so much for your wonderfully detailed review! We’re thrilled to hear that you enjoyed The Bartizan’s unique blend of historic charm and modern comfort, along with our prime location in the heart of Galle Fort. It’s great to know that the suite with a private balcony overlooking the ocean provided you with a serene experience. We appreciate your feedback on the air conditioning, and we’re looking into ways to ensure our rooms remain comfortable during warmer nights. 

We’re also delighted that our courtyard dining and locally sourced dishes added to your stay, even without a traditional restaurant. Our team takes immense pride in providing warm, personalized service, so we’re happy to hear that their efforts made your visit even more enjoyable. Thank you again for your high recommendation; it means a lot to us. We look forward to welcoming you back for another memorable stay in this remarkable location!

Kind regards, 
The Bartizan Team
placeInfo/address: 77 Pedlar Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
The Bartizan Hotel is ideally situated within the historic Galle Fort in Sri Lanka, a UNESCO World Heritage site. Its prime location provides easy access to the fort's ramparts and Pedlar Street, which is just around the corner. This makes it convenient for guests to explore the charming streets and cultural attractions of Galle Fort.

The rooms at The Bartizan Hotel offer a pleasing blend of modern comfort and historic charm. Each room is tastefully decorated, featuring elegant furnishings and thoughtful details that reflect the rich history of Galle. We stayed in a suite with a private balcony overlooking the ocean, providing a serene and picturesque setting. The bed was incredibly comfortable, ensuring a restful night's sleep. However, the air conditioner struggled to keep the room cool during the warm nights.

The hotel does not have a traditional restaurant, but a courtyard area with café tables serviced by a competent team in the kitchen. The food offers a delightful dining experience with a focus on fresh, locally sourced ingredients. Despite the lack of a formal restaurant, the culinary offerings were impressive and thoroughly enjoyable.

The service at The Bartizan Hotel is wonderful. The staff are warm, friendly, and go out of their way to ensure that every guest feels welcome and well taken care of. From personalized recommendations for local attractions to thoughtful touches throughout our stay, the level of hospitality was outstanding.

The Bartizan Hotel offers a unique and memorable experience in the heart of Galle Fort. The combination of its historic charm, luxurious accommodations, and outstanding service makes it a standout choice for anyone visiting Galle. Highly recommended for a truly special stay in a remarkable location.
title: Lovely Boutique Hotel in Galle

While we strive to maintain high standards of cleanliness and comfort, it seems we fell short during your stay. We take your comments seriously and will address these issues with our team to ensure improvements are made.

Regarding the water replenishment and amenities, we will review our policies to better meet the needs of our guests. We aim to provide good value for our services, and we regret that this was not your experience.

Your feedback is invaluable to us as we continue to enhance our services, and we hope to have the opportunity to welcome you back for a better experience in the future.

Best regards,

placeInfo/address: 77 Pedlar Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Just be mindful of the fact that they don’t serve any sort of food after about 4pm if ur travelling with kids.. rest all good!
text:
We stayed one night at the bartizan.. the hotel has lovely vibes , and is a great place to stay . It’s walking distance from all the restaurants, hardly a 2 min walk. Also it’s across the street from where u can walk/ view the ocean so location is brilliant. 
Our room was really spacious and well kept. Only suggestion I would have for them is to put another smaller air conditioner in the section with the 2 other beds as it’s quite hot there, coz ac air doesn’t reach. The balcony is of a nice size and loo is 👍👍
The breakfast was super. You have to order when u reach so that they can have it ready morning. It’s a small operation it seems..
A good thing to note is that once the kitchen is shut then there’s literally nothing for u to eat, which means by 4pm I think.. u need to get it from outside. They did say they serve lunch but I’m really not sure..
That said, it’s very very close to all the restaurants so manageable .
Would definitely stay here again ..

placeInfo/address: 77 Pedlar Street, Galle 80000 Sri Lanka
text:
We stayed three nights here whilst touring. The property is boutique with some charm and very well located in the old town. We were kindly upgraded to balcony room with seaview which was appreciated. Room was quirky, huge and well equipped, only thing missing was a tv but that did not trouble us. Staff were friendly and helpful and it was nice to be offered breakfast on our balcony. I even managed a couple of swims on little beach opposite the hotel. 
Only downside was that the property is popular for wedding/fashion photoshoots in the courtyard (where guests eat) and turret beside our room, and there were several such over our stay which we found intrusive. I was told this started over covid restrictions to bring in cash, which is understandable, but then continued. Seems like owners are selling the same small facilities twice.
title: Charming property in good location.

placeInfo/address: Colombo City Centre, 137 Muttiah Road Colombo City Centre Mall and Residences, Colombo 00200 Sri Lanka
placeInfo/addressObj/street2: Colombo City Centre Mall and Residences
text:
I had a wonderful stay at this hotel, which is directly connected to the Colombo City Centre Mall—very convenient for shopping and dining. It’s also just a 5-minute walk to the beach area, where you can enjoy a gorgeous sunset along with delicious food and drinks at nearby restaurants.

The hotel features a lovely rooftop poolside restaurant, perfect for relaxing with a drink or enjoying a peaceful dinner with a view.

The staff were incredibly friendly, welcoming, and always ready to help—true Sri Lankan hospitality. One small area for improvement is the response time when calling the main operator (dialing 0); it sometimes took two or three calls to get through.

Breakfast was also enjoyable, offering a good variety of international and local cuisines.

If you’re visiting Colombo, I highly recommend staying at—or at least stopping by—this beautiful hotel.
title: A Beautiful Hotel with Stunning Views and Excellent Location

text:
I just came to Colombo on family vacation and stayed at Courtyard Colombo Hotel.
We had a truly wonderful stay here.  From the moment we arrived, the staff was warm, welcoming, and attentive to every detail. 
Even before We started our journey from India the team from hotel connected me and ask about all my preferences for our stay.
When we checked into the room it was immaculate, well-appointed, and offered a perfect balance of comfort and style. I especially appreciated the little touches—such as the complimentary refreshments, luxurious bedding, and thoughtful amenities and my preference a room close to elevator, non smoking and nice views - all have been taken care.

The hotel's location was ideal, making it easy to explore the surrounding area and adjacent to City Centre mall makes the place more attractive.
Breakfast each morning was fresh and delicious, with a great variety of options. The team at breakfast were very attentive and taken care of all our need.

I also want to commend the housekeeping and concierge teams for their exceptional service throughout our stay.

Thank you for a memorable experience Elton John and Team !
title: Relaxation and Elegance in One Place blended with Exceptional Service and Comfort @ Courtyard Colombo

placeInfo/address: Sandungama Rd, Ella 90090 Sri Lanka
text: We had 2 days of unforgettable stay at Ekho-Ella with fabulous SriLankan hospitality. The location is absolutely magical with stunning views. Breakfast at the hotel had a nice spread of SriLankan and western food. Dinner was brilliant with 4 course. The staff like Nissan, Umesh and all others were welcoming, friendly and professional. All of them looked after us very well, thank you Ekho-Ella, we had a great time during our stay.
title: Magical stay at Ekho-Ella

placeInfo/address: Sandungama Rd, Ella 90090 Sri Lanka
text:
From the moment we arrived, we were welcomed with such warmth by the staff friendly, attentive, and genuinely lovely people who made us feel instantly at home.

The location is perfect right in the heart of Ella

The gardens are just beautiful, and we were lucky enough to wake early and wander down to watch the sunrise. It was calm, quiet, and absolutely breathtaking, a moment we won’t forget. I also joined the morning yoga session, which was such a refreshing way to start the day.

Dinner was delicious, amazing local Sri Lankan cuisine fresh, full of flavour, and made even better knowing so much of it came from their own garden.

Our room was private, spotless, and super comfortable. And then there’s the view… wow. Spectacular doesn’t even come close. You could sit and stare for hours.

Our stay was only one night, but it left such an impression. We truly wish we had stayed longer and now, we have the perfect reason to return to Ella and to EKHO Ella.
title: Something Special

placeInfo/address: Sandungama Rd, Ella 90090 Sri Lanka
text:
A Magical Stay at EKHO Ella – Too Short but Unforgettable!
We stayed one night at EKHO Ella and were completely blown away. The location is absolutely stunning, with breathtaking views of both Adam’s Peak and Ella Rock right from the hotel. It was hard to leave such a peaceful and beautiful place.

The highlight for us was the food – both breakfast and dinner were absolutely amazing, with a great variety and full of flavour. The staff were warm and welcoming, and the service was excellent from check-in to check-out.

Although our stay was short, EKHO Ella left a lasting impression. Highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting the area – we only wish we had booked more nights
title: Ella

placeInfo/address: Sandungama Rd, Ella 90090 Sri Lanka
roomTip: If you want to eat dinner at the hotel you will have to wait until 8pm if you're hungry go to the city it’s only a few minutes walking
text: Great view and staff thank you priyahtha and thakshila. The breakfast was very delicious and the welcoming dessert when arriving is to die for!
title: Great!

placeInfo/address: Sandungama Rd, Ella 90090 Sri Lanka
roomTip: June is a perfect month for weather and less crowds. We hear the busy season starts in August. Don’t forget to swim in the waterfalls.
text:
6/5 stars! What a stay! What a view! The service was top notch! 
Ekho Ella did not disappoint. We are sad to leave. I can’t remember the last time I felt this relaxed. The pictures on their site do not do this hotel justice. Make sure to catch a sunrise with yoga session overlooking the canyon to start your day. Breakfast, either local or western will surely satisfy your cravings. Hats off to Umesh and the other servers. Amazing service all day long. The staff is always smiling with a friendly atmosphere and helpful tips to explore this gem of an area.  The first night at dinner had a fantastic flute player who had a wide array of flutes from around the world. Rooms are clean and have a unique train station theme. Room 105 was perfect. Small comfy patio with a million dollar view. I can’t say enough about how amazing our stay was. I only wish we had more time. Thank you to all the Ekho Ella staff and we hope to see you again.
title: AMAZING STAY!

placeInfo/address: Sandungama Rd, Ella 90090 Sri Lanka

We had a very relaxed stay at EKHO Ella.
From the hotel itself with its stunning view to the hospitality of the staff and the amazing food provided for our stay, made our vacation quite enjoyable. Special thanks to Sanjeewa in F&B, and Priyantha for being accommodating to our requests. 😊
title: Great experience!

placeInfo/address: Sandungama Rd, Ella 90090 Sri Lanka
roomTip: EKHO is located on a mountain range with a breathtaking views. Hotel is a wonderful place to see the sunrise.
text:
All the staff were friendly, helpful and polite and go out of the way to accommodate the guests.

In particular Priyantha and also the other members of the staff came and checked our needs almost daily basis during the stay and provided where to visit for sightseeing.
title: This was our first time to Ella and enjoyed visiting breathtaking views.

placeInfo/address: Sandungama Rd, Ella 90090 Sri Lanka
text:
Waking up to the iconic “V” mountain view from EKHO Ella was surreal. The scenery felt like a living postcard, with Ella Gap glowing in the morning light.

What stood out just as much as the view was the service...5-star care in a boutique hotel. Seni, the manager, was always present but never intrusive. He ensured even the smallest details—like getting the coffee just right—were handled with precision.

Priyatha at the front desk checked in on us throughout the stay, making sure everything ran smoothly. And Sjwani, who served us daily, truly went the extra mile. My wife’s vegetarian meals were made exactly to preference, and baby food was thoughtfully arranged without reminders. 

EKHO Ella is where nature, comfort, and personal care come together. Would return without a second thought.
title: Breathtaking Views and 5-Star Boutique Hospitality

Also great breakfast with a lot of options. Friendly staff. Located in a narrow street, but walking distance from the main street with plenty of shops and restaurants, which is fun to walk around.
title: Great! With a beautiful view!

placeInfo/address: Waterfall Road, Ella 90090 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Bloß kein Zimmer mit Gartenblick!!!
text: Wir haben 2 Nächte in unterschiedlichen Kategorien über 2 Portale gebucht. Die erste Nacht hatten wir das teurere Deluxe Zimmer (30,- Euro mehr) mit Gartenblick und waren am Morgen sehr ernüchtert. Der Blick ging nicht in den Garten, sondern auf einen halbfertigen Hotelkomplex. Schrecklich… umgezogen in das preiswerte Zimmer mit Blick in die herrlichen Berge und alles war fein. Die Einrichtung ist zwar etwas älter, aber die Aussicht entschädigt für alles. Frühstück gab es leider nur innen. Die Bilder implizierten etwas anders. Keine Terrasse vorhanden! Na ja, wer Plastikblumen und Fahrstuhlmusik mag ist hier richtig. Das Personal ist sehr freundlich und die Lage ist super! Man wohnt ruhig und ist schnell auf der trubeligen Hauptstraße.
title: 2 Nächte - 2 Bewertungen!

Dejligt beliggende hotel med flot udsigt.
Værelser og badeværelse pænt og der er plads til udpakkede kufferter.
God morgenmadsbuffet, som er varieret og personalet er meget venlige hjælpsomme - og gode til engelsk.

I 2026 er hotellets rooftop med pool færdig (nok sidst i 2025).

placeInfo/address: Waterfall Road, Ella 90090 Sri Lanka
text: Lovely hotel, with the friendliest and most helpful staff. Great view from the balcony in our room. It is up a very steep hill, so we did use tuktuks up and down to the town, I've hurt my knee, but it is walkable if you are fit. Just missing a pool which is currently being built on the roof so will then be perfect. Spotlessly clean and the food choice at breakfast was good. The manager/concierge was particularly helpful planning a day with a tuktuk around the sights of Ella that I would be able to manage, he also recommended some amazing places to eat in town.
title: Great base in Ella

placeInfo/address: Ella Passara Road Ellawaththa, 7th Mile Post, Ella 90090 Sri Lanka
roomTip: Drive from hotel to main road is slow 15mins each way so factor that into your timings but views and tranquility worth it.
text:
We had a lovely stay at Manjentra Hotel in Ella. The staff were incredibly helpful and kind, always going out of their way to make us feel welcome. The garden was beautifully maintained, and you could see the care and effort that goes into keeping the surroundings so peaceful and inviting.

A big thank you to the young lads who drove us up and down the driveway — they were always patient, friendly, and reliable. The hotel is a little set back from the main road, so it's worth allowing about 15 minutes each way, but the team were always happy to assist with transport, which made it easy.

The views from the hotel were absolutely stunning, offering a tranquil escape and a perfect place to unwind.

As we were leaving, the team surprised us with some fresh bananas from their garden — such a thoughtful gesture, and they were absolutely delicious. A small touch that summed up the warmth and hospitality of our stay.

If you're after a peaceful stay with great service, natural beauty, and genuine care, Manjentra Hotel is a wonderful choice.
title: Helpful Staff, Stunning Views, and a Peaceful Stay – Manjentra Hotel, Ella
